Yusra is a 42-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Yusra started her business years ago with a modest grocery store. With her hard work she is now a proud owner of a supermarket and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase goods for her store. She is looking to expand her business more and more.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Nabela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 49-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and she has six children.

Nabeela is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase home products and do maintenance for the kitchen with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase home products and do maintenance for the kitchen

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram is a 53-year-old man, married with two children. He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop. Akram has five years of experience in this field which qualifies him as a knowledgeable and skilled person. The food products he sells are very popular among the people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling food is 300 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). His wife helps him to sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location in the central bazaar of his home city.

Akram would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose, he applied for 1500 AZN. He will purchase additional foodstuffs and diversify. This will be his third loan and he has a positive credit history.

loans.use: to diversify and buy additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Sinob

texts.en:
Sinob and his wife, Phallin, are farmers. They grow beans, cauliflower and tomatoes on their farmland in the village where they live. Sinob had asked for a Kiva loan one time already. He is now requesting another loan of $1,200 to purchase a water pumping machine to spray his farm, and to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm. The couple has been married since 2008 and they live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Photo: Sinob is standing next to the water pumping machine which he wanted to buy. He bought it, but he didn't give the money yet. So, he is asking for the loan to pay for the purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine to spray his farm, and to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman is a 47-year-old man who is married with six children. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods like flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies. He has 10 years of experience and has a deep knowledge of the market and the demands of clients. 

The food products he sells are very popular among people and in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is about 230 AZN.  His wife helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income for the family. Mehman is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, which is in the central bazaar of his home town.

He applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods to cover customers` demands.

loans.use: to buy and diversify the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Ruqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqiya is married and has four sons and two daughters. Her two elder sons work with their father while the others are studying.

Ruqiya also helps her husband by working in the fields. Her husband grows different crops like cotton, wheat, etc., in different seasons. He is a very hardworking person and is very dedicated to his work in his fields.

Ruqiya is also a very good housewife and a great mother who performs her household duties very well.

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her family business. With the loan investment, her husband will buy fertilizers and seeds to grow better quality crops and increase his profits.

Ruqiya is very confident that a loan investment will be a productive one for her husband’s business, and it will help her family to live a better financial life.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called the Asasah Passbook is Ruqiya.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for the farming business.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 41-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Manal is selling clothes and working from her home. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase additional quantities of clothes for business purposes.

Manal is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional quantities of clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Seema's Group

texts.en:
Seema has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her decorative embroidery business. She is expert in hand embroidery and uses beautiful looking beads in her work. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month.

With the loan investment, she will buy embroidery material such as thread, beads, and embroidery frames in larger quantity that will allow her to make better-looking clothes and increase her profits.

Seema is the mother of a son and a daughter. Her son is a tailor while her daughter works with her and helps her fill the clients orders on time. Seema is very confident that her business will grow further after investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Seema.

loans.use: To buy beads, thread, etc. for embroidery business

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s local food restaurant. With the loan investment, he will buy flour and other food making ingredients in larger quantity for preparing better quality food. He will also buy some furniture to provide better sitting arrangement for his clients. This will put good impact on his business and will improve his business situation.

Surriya is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has got great sewing skills and her clients are very satisfied with her quality of work. She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well.

She is confident that her husband will get great success in his business after investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Surriya.

loans.use: To buy food making ingredients for food selling business

loans.name: Maria Yessenia

texts.es: Maria Yessenia, de 27 años de edad ella anterior mente manejo un credito el cual invirtio en negocio de venta de ropa Américana  el cual se encuentra administrando actual mente gracias a Dio menciona ella,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de un lote de ropa donde ella pueda surtir aun mas su negocio,pero su sueño no solamente queda alli si no que tambien ella quere invertir en un lote de zapatos Américanos ya que considera ella es necesario para atraer mas a la clientela,es por ello que esta solicitando este credito,asi poder lograr sus metas,y sus sueños que tiene para este año, sabiendo que Dios la va a Bendecir grandemente en su negocio por lo que ella espera tomen en cuenta su solicitud y de antemano deseandoles muchas bendiciones.
texts.en: Maria Yessenia, 27, had a prior loan which she invested in her business selling American clothing.  Today she is still working in this business, thanks to God.  She says that she is requesting this loan to buy a bale of clothing to stock up her business.  But her dream is not only to buy clothing but to also to buy a quantity of American shoes, because she thinks she needs this in order to attract more customers.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to achieve these goals and the dreams she has for this year, knowing that God will greatly bless her business.  And so, she hopes that you will consider her request, and in advance she wishes you many blessings.

loans.use: to buy clothing and American shoes to sell

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchos deseos de progresar. Está separada hace varios años del padre de sus hijos. Habita cómodamente su propia casa en compañía de su hija de 24 años de edad y su madre  a quien brinda cuidados por su avanzada edad.  La actividad que realiza Maritza es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de todo tipo, para esto abrió un pequeño local en su propia casa donde atiende muy amablemente  a sus clientes. Iniciándose hace 06 años comprando en pequeñas cantidades, viendo que le iba bien decidió continuar en invertir comprando mayor cantidad de mercadería para tener un stock disponible para la venta y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Lo considera rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja.  Después de la separación del padre de su hija, se vinieron muchas necesidades económicas, decidiéndose a iniciar hace 06 años un negocio para generarse un ingreso que le pudiera ayudarse, de esa manera ha podido sacar adelante a su hija y pagarles  sus estudios, siendo  sus mayor orgullo. Deseando en un futuro convertirse en una distribuidora de bebidas viendo  crecer su negocio y convertirse en una prospera empresaria. Este será el préstamo  número 05 con la institución MFP, Esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en compra de mayor volumen  mercadería para su negocio que son las bebidas gasificadas para tener un stock disponible para la venta, viendo crecer su negocio y buscará los precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen con la finalidad de aumentar sus márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Maritza, 44 years old, is a hard-working, dedicated woman, with a great desire to get ahead in life. She has been separated from the father of her children for several years. She lives comfortably in her own house, along with her 24-year-old daughter and with her mother, for whom she provides care due to her advanced age. Maritza's business activity is the sale of all types of soft drinks. To do this, she opened a small location in her own house where she takes very nice care of her customers. She began this business six years ago by purchasing small quantities. Seeing that it was going well, she decided to continue investing by purchasing a larger quantity of merchandise to have stock available for sale, and up until now she has run this business by herself. She considers it profitable based on the good earnings that it provides her. After her separation from the father of her daughter, she had many economic needs, so she decided to start this business six years ago to generate income that could help her. This is how she has managed to help her daughter advance and to pay for her education, this being her greatest pride. In the future she would like to become a beverage distributor, see her business increase, and become a prosperous entrepreneur.

This will be her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, since that way she can be sure that she'll be able to move her business forward. Additionally, she is committed once again to making her payments, as she did with previous loans that she received. Also, she likes being part of her communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and supportive people.

With the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN), she will invest in the purchase of a greater volume of merchandise for her business, which is selling soft drinks. This way she can have stock available for sale, and see her business increase. She will seek the best prices for her bulk purchases, with the goal of increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sheilah

texts.es:
Sheilah, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además tiene muchas  ideas de negocios e ilusiones de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Percy quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus 2 hijos Nayeli de 11 y Percy de 8 años de edad. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Sheilah es la venta de productos de belleza como esmaltes, cremas faciales, perfumes y otros. Todos estos productos son comprados por catálogos para ser vendidos desde su casa entes sus vecinas y amistades siendo sus clientes habituales, además de los recomendados. 
Se inició hace más de 8 años contando con un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola.
Considera  a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja al acabar todos los productos que tiene en stock. Además cuenta que se decidió a empezar con su negocio, ya que antes vendía comidas y el calor de la cocina le perjudicaba su salud y viendo reducidos los ingresos de su hogar, quiso apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, además de contar con un oficio y sentirse una persona productiva.
Por tanto, espera poder aumentar el stock de su mercadería y ver crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además nos comenta que está contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues vienen apoyando a las personas con financiamiento de sus proyectos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de mercadería de productos de belleza  para aumentar su stock, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras, de esa manera obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sheilah, 33 years old, is a hardworking and earnest woman who has a lot of business ideas and dreams of getting ahead. She lives with Percy who works in transport and is the father of their two children Nayeli, 11 years old, and Percy, 8 years old. They live together comfortably in their own howm. Sheilah sells beauty products like nail polish, face cream, perfumes, etc. All of these products are purchased via catalogue in order to be sold from her home to her neighbor and friends, being her regular customers along with those who are referred. 

She began more than eight years ago using her own funds from her saving, and so far she’s been working on her own. 

She considers her business to be profitable due to the earnings it provides once she’s run out of all the products she has in stock. She tells us that she decided to start her business since before she sold food and the heat from the kitchen was endangering her health and, seeing the decrease in household income, she wanted to help her partner with the household expenses and to have a job and feel like a productive person. 

She wants to be able to increase her stock of merchandise and see her business grow. This will be the 5th loan with MFP. She hopes for a small loan in order to be able to meet her objectives. She tells us that she’s happy with the communal bank’s work since they are supporting people with funding their projects. She will invest the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles into the purchase of beauty products to increase her stock. She’s looking for good prices for her purchases so that she can get better profits.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap is a 32-year-old mother of six children who are still in school. To provide the primary basic needs of this big family, she has been growing corn and peppers for five years.

Pheap joined VisionFund four years ago and she successfully managed to pay back the loan with VisionFund. The loan has made a better living for her. With the satisfactory result, she formed a group with another member and they are requesting a new loan in the amount of KHR 1,400,000 and 1,000,000 respectively. As the leader, Pheap will buy seeds, fertilizer, and a water pump for her cornfield and pepper plantation. She hopes that her cash crop will grow well and increase its crop yield so that she can gradually improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and a water pump for her cornfield and pepper plantation.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a very active and efficient lady. She helps her husband in his grocery store business which he operates from his home and sells daily use items like spices, snacks, etc. to his community clients at very reasonable prices.

Actually, Zarina’s husband has two businesses. In the morning he drives a rented rickshaw and provides transport services to his passengers while in the evening he operates his grocery selling business. In his absence, Zarina takes care of the grocery business and deals with the customers very professionally.

She has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her sons work while her daughter remains at home and helps her in her daily household tasks.

Zarina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan investment, he will buy grocery stock such as cooking oils, spices, etc. in bulk quantity that will allow him to address the clients' needs and increase his sales and profits.

Zarina is very hopeful that her husband will be able to make good use of the loan money and that it will improve his income.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zarina.

loans.use: To buy grocery items such as cooking oils, spices, etc. for grocery store business

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr is 39 years old. He lives in Talin with his wife and two children. Norayr runs a little farm, where he has been breeding cattle for nine years already. Norayr is also a builder and does construction work to earn additional income. 

Norayr has applied for this loan to develop his farm. With the loan's help he plans to purchase cattle and forage. With more heads of cattle, Norayr hopes to increase his current income from agriculture (100,000 Armenian Drams) 60 percent. This will allow Norayr to purchase some agricultural machines for his farm and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is 43 years old. She lives with her husband, son and mother-in-law. For  25 years already, the family has been involved in agriculture, which helped them to have stable source of income through these years. Astghik breeds sheep and cultivates potatoes, beans and wheat on their land. 

Now Astghik has some plans to develop both cattle breeding and farming. With the requested loan she plans to purchase seeds to cultivate the land and forage for the sheep, and a cow. This loan will allow Astghik to earn more income and invest in her farm's further expansion in the future.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, forage and a cow

loans.name: Haine

texts.es: Haine, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial. Es conviviente con Nehemías quien se dedica al transporte fluvial y es padre de sus 2 hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Haine es la venta de productos de belleza como cosméticos, perfumes, cremas entre otros. Todos estos son comprados por catalogo y vendidos desde su casa a sus familiares, vecinos y amistades, a quienes les brinda una atención amable y cordial ganándose  sus preferencia, y ellos la recomiendan con otras personas. Tiene más de 3 años dedicándose a este negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes. Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos, el contar con un oficio y sentirse una persona productiva, además de poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja por la demanda que tiene. Por consiguiente, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y adquirir una vitrina para exhibir sus productos. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como productos de belleza y ropas de damas, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras la contado.
texts.en: Haine, 31, is a dedicated and hardworking woman, who is also warm and friendly.  She lives with Nehemías, who works in inland water transportation and is the father of their 2 children aged 13 and 9.  They live together comfortably in their own home.  Haine has a business selling beauty products such as cosmetics, perfumes, creams, and other products.  She buys all of these products through a catalog, and she sells them from her home to her relatives, neighbors and friends.  She wins their business by providing them with friendly and cordial service, and they also recommend her to other people.  She has had this business for more than 3 years now, and up until now her partner has supported her in seeking new customers.  She likes this business because of the income she earns, and she enjoys having a job and feeling like a productive person.  In addition, she can help her partner with the household expenses.  She considers her business to be sufficiently profitable with the earnings it generates, given the demand that she has.  Consequently, she has plans to continue with her business and acquire a glass display case to show off her products.  This will be her 3rd loan with the MFP institution.  Therefore, she awaits your support so that she can continue to work toward her goals.  Also, she comments that she feels very comfortable in her communal bank, because she thinks it is a united and supportive group.  With the sum of 1,200 Peruvian soles requested she will invest in merchandise, such as beauty products and women's clothing, looking to purchase these items at low cost because she will pay for them in cash.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and women's clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Huch's Group

texts.en:
Huch, 42, is one of the villagers in the Ratanak Mondul district in Cambodia. She is the breadwinner in the family and has four children. All of them work for others for pay in order to provide additional support for this family.  Since corn is one of the common crops and can be sold at the market easily, she grows corn for sale so as to make a living. She has been with this business for five years.

Huch took her first loan with VisionFund in 2010 and completely paid it back. The loan has enabled her to have proper living conditions and to have decent food daily. Joined with another member for the newly requested loan, she is applying for a loan in the amount of KHR 1,200,000. As the group leader, she will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her cornfield. She hopes to earn more income from her crop yield and keep improving her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her cornfield.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn is 40 years old and has six dependent children. With her effort, she has managed to send all of her six children to school. She has been growing corn for twenty years as the main income to feed the entire family.

This is the forth cycle loan for Sokhorn with VisionFund. She succeeded in already paying back the three former consecutive loans with VisionFund. The loans have helped her to overcome her family’s hardship, especially in having proper shelter and food. 

Being empowered by the previous loans, she and her group, consisting of two other members, are requesting a new loan of KHR 700,000 each. As the leader, Sokhorn will use this loan to buy fertilizer and a water pump for her corn plantation. She hopes to generate more income from the cash crop and continue to have decent food for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a water pump for her corn plantation.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
At age 54, Sokhom is the mother of six children living in one of the rural areas of Thmor Kuol district, Cambodia. Out of the six children, she has to be responsible for a son who works as a lath operator. She makes a living through rice farming, the only business which she has been with for twenty years.

Sokhom has just joined VisionFund this cycle. She forms a group with two other members, and she is the group leader. She is requesting a new loan of KHR 1,000,000 to buy seeds and hire labor for plowing her farmland. She hopes that her rice will healthfully grow and produce a better crop yield for her to generate more income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and hire labor for plowing her farmland.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera is 35 years old. She lives with her mother. Vera runs a farm where she grows different kinds of fruits and vegetables. Vera's mother always helps her with the farming. Vera would like to get involved in cattle breeding, too. To implement this goal, she has applied for this loan. Vera plans to purchase young pigs with the loan. Besides that, she will purchase poles to grow grapes, seeds to cultivate the land and fertilizer. This will help Vera to earn more income and live a life of higher quality.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, poles and young pigs

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, además de ser amable y cordial en su trato con las personas. Es conviviente con james quien es empleado y padre de sus 4 hijos, Billy, James, Johnny y Patrick de 12, 10, 7 y 2 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan la casa de su hermana, cuentan con terreno propio pero no lo habitan por la lejanía. 

La actividad que realiza Jesús es la venta de comidas como tallarines, estofados, juanes  y refrescos por las mañanas en un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad, donde atiende cordialmente a sus clientes quienes la visitan a diario por la buena sazón en sus preparaciones.
Se inició hace más de 1 año, por iniciativa y capital propia, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando con el apoyo de su hermana con quien comparte las ganancias.
Considera su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y le has servido para salir de muchos apuros, además de conseguir terminar todo lo que prepara para la venta y si en caso sobra le sirve de alimento en su casa, de esa manera no se desperdicia nada. Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por el deseo de contar con sus propios ingreso y no depender únicamente de su pareja, más bien apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, sabiendo que con el apoyo mutuo saldrán  adelante más fácilmente. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, está ahorrando sus ganancias pues desea en un futuro abrir una bodega de abarrotes en su casa, para así estar más cerca de sus hijos durante el día. Éste será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida y contenta de saber que contara con un apoyo financiero para realizar sus planes. Por eso se compromete a  cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además está a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que se brindan mutuamente.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus alimentos como arroz, azúcar, aceites y otros. Buscará preciso bajos por sus compras en volumen, así tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jesús is 33, she is a hard working woman in addition to being nice and friendly to other people. She lives with James who is employed and the father of their four children: Billy, James, Johnny and Patrick ages 12, 10, 7 and 2 respectively.  Together they live at her sister's house, they have a piece of land they own but they don't live there because it's far.  

Jesús sells food like pasta, stews, sodas and "juanes" (like a tamal except made with rice) n the morning at a market location in the city where she gladly serves her customers who visit her daily for the good taste of her meals.  She started more than a year ago, self-motivated and with her own capital, to this day she is supported by her sister with whom she shares her earnings.  She considers her business to be profitable and it has helped them through many difficult times, even when sometimes she doesn't sell out of food and brings it home to feed her family, this way nothing is wasted.

She decided to get started on this business because she wished to have her own income and not depend only on her significant other, but actually help him with the home expenses and bring a better quality of life to their family, knowing that helping each other they will get ahead easier. This is why, seeing the good results she's had so far, she is saving some earnings to in open a convenience store from her house in the future, and this way be closer to her children during the day.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She is thankful and happy for knowing that she counts with the financial support to realize her goals.  She commits to repay her loan like she has with previous loans.  She is also happy with the community bank for the mutual support they give each other. With the amount requested of 1,000 new soles, she will buy ingredients to make food such as rice, sugar oil and others.  She will look for low prices to buy in volume and have more profit.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, de 60 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, que trabajó a los largo de su vida buscando progresar sin descanso. Es separada del padre de sus hijos. Vive cómodamente en su propia casa en compañía de 2 de sus hijos: Eber e Iris de 22 y 28 años de edad respectivamente y su nieta Erika de 20 años  de edad.
La actividad que realiza Rosario es la elaboración y venta de carbón a base de desechos de maderas de los aserraderos cercanos. Tiene un espacio cerca a los aserraderos donde apila sus maderas y los prende fuego dejando quemar por varios días quedando listo el carbón para venta teniendo varios pedidos por atender, logrando la satisfacción de sus clientes.
Se inicio hace más de 30 años, empezando de a poco con un capital propio que fue haciendo crecer con bastante esfuerzo, y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de sus hijos en la preparación y venta del carbón.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que les deja, así como la demanda que le permite vender todos su producción.
Se decidió en empezar con su actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para sostener  a su familia ya es padre y madre para sus hijos logrando sacarlos adelante brindándoles su educación siendo su mayor orgullo. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados y las ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo pues es su único sustento. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP. Está contenta y agradecida de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para seguir avanzando con su negocio. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce  a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de su material principal para la elaboración de sus carbon que son los desechos de madera buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Rosario, 60 years old, is a hard-working, dedicated woman, who has worked tirelessly throughout her life, trying to get ahead. She is separated from the father of her children. She lives comfortably in her own house, along with two of her children: Eber and Iris, 22 and 28 years old, respectively, and with her 20-year-old granddaughter, Erika.

Rosario's business activity is the fabrication and sale of charcoal, made from wood scraps from nearby sawmills. She has a space near the sawmills where she gathers her wood scraps and sets them on fire, allowing the pile to burn for several days until the charcoal is ready for sale. The sales fulfill the various orders that she has, leaving her customers satisfied.

She began her business more than thirty years ago, starting slowly with her own capital, which she grew through significant effort. Up to the present time, she has continued in this work, with the help of her children for the preparation and sale of the charcoal. She considers her business profitable because of the good earnings that it provides to her, as well as the demand that allows her to sell all of her product.

She decided to begin this business because she needed to be able to count on income to support her family, given that she is both mother and father for her children. She managed to raise her children well and provide them with an education, which is her greatest pride. Seeing the good results and earnings that her business is providing, she would like to continue with it, as it is her only support. This will be her fifth loan with MFP. She is happy and thankful to know that she will be able to count on financial support to continue forward with her business. She is also comfortable with her communal bank because she knows the members and considers them to be responsible people. With the requested amount of 1500 nuevos soles (PEN), she will invest in the purchase of the principal material for the fabrication of her charcoal, which is the wood scraps. She will seek the lowest prices for her purchases in bulk.

loans.use: to buy wood scraps to make charcoal.

loans.name: Betzayda

texts.es:
Betzayda de 26 años convive con Edwin de 24 años fruto de este gran amor tienen una hija, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Torrerumi del distrito de Sivia.
Betzayda es una madre joven, con deseo de superarse; ella se dedica al trabajo en la agricultura donde cultiva café, cacao y plátano en su parcela ubicada a 10 minutos de su casa. Antes de dedicarse a esta labor, estaba estudiando en la provincia de huamanga pero por factores económicos no llego a concluir sus estudios y aparte de ello conoció al que ahora es su conviviente, luego nació su pequeña, por lo que tuvieron una responsabilidad mas y  decidieron incursionar en la agricultura en donde les va muy bien en su producción. El único inconveniente es que para trasladar sus productos es un poco tedioso, ya que no cuentan con movilidad propia.
En un futuro esta pensando dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes y verduras en su propia comunidad.
Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella una vez más se compromete en cancelar sus cuotas.
Ella esta contenta con su banco comunal por que les enseña a ser puntuales y solidario.
Con los 2,500 invertirá en la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Betzayda, 26 years old, lives with Edwin, who is also 26 years old. As the result of their great love, they have a daughter. They live in their own home in the Torrerumi community in the district of Sivia. 

Betzayda is a young mother with a desire to better herself. She works in agriculture, growing coffee, cacao, and bananas on her plot of land, which is located 10 minutes from her home. Before devoting herself to this work, she was studying in the Huamanga province. Due to economic factors, however,  she was unable to complete her studies. Apart from that situation, she also met the man she now lives with, and, later, the little one arrived. Since she now had an additional responsibility, she decided to venture into agriculture. Their production is going very well. The only downside is that moving their products is a little tedious, since they do not have their own means of transportation. 

Betzayda is thinking of someday making her living selling groceries and vegetables in her own community. 

This is Betzayda's second loan with Kiva's partner MFP, and again she commits to cancel her debt. She is happy with her communal bank because they teach her and their other members to be punctual and supportive of each other. She will invest the 2,500 Peruvian Nuevo Soles (PEN) in the construction of her home.

loans.use: To buy materials in order to complete the construction of her home.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino de 48 años de edad casado con Amanda de 48 años fruto de este amor tienen un hijo ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Torrerumi del distrito de Sivia.
Paulino es la persona mas entusiasta y dinámico de su banco comunal, él trabaja como agricultor desde que era muy  joven, cuenta que sus ancestros siempre fueron agricultores y el tampoco desea dejar este legado mas al contrario esta innovando y mejorando su producción con el único fin de lograr mejores beneficios, de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades que la familia pueda tener.
Paulino cultiva cacao y plátano, en su parcela ubicada en Torrerumi juntamente con su querida esposa y los vende en el distrito de Sivia, el en un futuro esta pensando comprar una mototaxi para que pueda trabajar en el distrito de Sivia, ya que vio que hay mucha demanda de este servicio.
El esta feliz con su trabajo por que  le deja una buena rentabilidad gracias a su buena producción que obtiene de sus plantaciones. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que él se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Él esta conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal por que les enseñan a ahorrar y ser puntuales.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizara la poda de su cultivo de cacao, para ello va a contratar peones.
texts.en:
Paulino is 48 years old and married to Amanda, who is also 48.  They have one son and live in a house they own in the Torrerumi community in the Sivia District.

Paulino is the most enthusiastic and dynamic partner in his community bank.  He has worked as a farmer since he was very young.  His ancestors have always been farmers.  He does not want to abandon this legacy and in fact works to innovate and improve production for the sole purpose of achieving better benefits to satisfy his family's needs.

Paulino grows cocoa and bananas along with his beloved wife on their plot of land in Torrerumi.  They sell their products in the Sivia District.  In the future, he is thinking of buying a motorcycle taxi to operate in the district Sivia as he has seen much demand for this service.

He is happy with his work because he thankfully receives good income from his crop production.  This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to make timely loan payments.  He is satisfied with the work of the community bank, where he was taught how to save and be punctual.

With the requested $375 he will carry out pruning of his cocoa crop, for which he will hire laborers.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 30 years old and married with two children. He runs a barber shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and employs one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shaving machines for his business.

loans.use: to buy shaving machines for his business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan es casado, tiene 53 años de edad, curso la educacion primaria, tiene 8 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía a elaborar cosas de barro, lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa qui8en se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su casa, ya espera dar una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is married, 53 years old and attended primary school. He has 8 children, 3 of whom are studying. He is an artisan and makes things out of clay. He has 10 years of experience and has the support of his wife who takes care of the household chores.
He is requesting a loan that he will use to install electricity in his house, since he wants to give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to pay the expenses to install electricity.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, además de ser alegre y cordial. Está separada del padre de sus 3 hijos Henry de 19, Jennifer de 14 y Juana de 3 años de edad por quienes se esfuerza en trabajar. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa que compró con el fruto de sus esfuerzos.  La actividad que realiza Margarita es la venta de comidas como menús, los cuales prepara en su casa y los lleva a sus clientes en una obra de construcción civil  a quienes da pensión, realizando cobros semanales, quienes quedan satisfechos por la buena sazón y la excelente atención que les brinda con su puntualidad.
Se inició hace más de 2 años con un préstamo particular y hasta el momento cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos en el traslado y entrega de sus pedidos. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja. Por otro lado cuenta  que se decidió a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de tener un oficio para mantener a sus hijos ya que se había separado del padre de sus hijos y la pensión que les dejaba no alcanzaba para cubrir sus gastos.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de abrir en un futuro un restaurante  en algún local alquilado de una zona comercial de la ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá comprando ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceites y otros en mayores cantidades y a precios más bajos, para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Margarita, 37 years old, is a hardworking and earnest woman with a great drive to get ahead as well as to be friendly and joyful. She is separated from the father of her three children-- Henry who is 19 years old, Jennifer who is 14 years old, and Juana who is 3 years old-- who are her motivation to work. Together they live comfortably in their own home which she bought with the fruits of her labor. Margarita’s business is selling meals which she makes in her home and brings to her customers at a civil construction site, and she collects payments weekly. Her customers are happy with the good flavor and the excellent service that she provides them with her punctuality.  

She began more than two years ago with a particular loan and so far she’s had her kids’ help with the transport and delivery of her orders. She feels that her business is very profitable due to the earnings it provides. On the other hand she says that she decided to begin her business due to needing a job in order to support her kids since she’d separated from their father and the child support was not enough to cover costs. 

Above all, now she’s seeing good results, and she has plans to open a restaurant in the future in some rented shop in the commercial area of the city. This will be her 3rd loan with MFP, and so she hopes for their help in order to continue with her goals. She again promises to comply with the terms of her agreement as with previous loans she’s had. Additionally, she likes her communal bank because she considers it to be a solid and unified group. She will invest the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles in the purchase of ingredients to make her meals like rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and other things in bulk quantities and at lower prices in order to have better profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and canned goods.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 21 years old and married with one child. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and employs one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, bread and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bread and rice to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 51 years old, married and has four children. He sells blouses, skirts and sweaters to earn a living. He has been in this business for six years and employs one person. He also does vegetable farming to earn extra income. Since Stephen joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand it in the future. He has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy blouses, skirts and sweaters for resale.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts and sweaters for resale.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is 58 years old, married and has four children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sugar, cooking oil and sodas for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Wallace

texts.en: Wallace is 23 years old. He runs a phone accessories shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for one year and describes his business as good because there is limited competition. He also does maize farming to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy mobile phone chargers and batteries.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone chargers and batteries to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy, 36, is married with three children. To earn a living, she is a dairy farmer. She has been in this business for five years and employs two people. Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two dairy cows and feed.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows and feed.

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Né  vers 1964 à Sikasso, Monsieur Daouda est un polygame qui a deux épouses et  quatre enfants. Il réside avec sa famille dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Mancourani I, le centre ville de Sikasso.
Après plusieurs années dans le métier du chauffeur, il décida il y a maintenant quatre ans de s’initier au métier familial, qu’est le métier de forgeron. Il achète des ferrailles pour en faire des objets de différentes sortes : Charrues, Semoirs, Charrettes, Dabas, Marmites, etc, qui seront vendus dans les marchés hebdomadaires des localités environnantes de Sikasso tels N’Tchongobougou, Kadiolo et Hérémakono, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
Il est beaucoup sollicité et les commandes de ses clients ne cessent d’augmenter mais ses ressources propres sont insuffisantes pour mieux satisfaire les attentes de sa clientèle. Ainsi pour palier ce problème, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a plus d’une année, et avec laquelle il est à son deuxième crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter une tonnes de ferraille.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce crédit un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de roulement, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Daouda was born circa 1964 in Sikasso. He's a polygamous man with two spouses and four children. He lives with them in a large extended family in Mancourani I, in downtown Sikasso.

After working several years as a taxi driver, he decided four years ago to learn his family's traditional trade, blacksmithing.

He purchases scrap metal and turns it into various objects: plows, seeders, carts, hoes, stock pots, etc.

He sells them at the weekly markets in several villages around Sikasso (N’Tchongobougou, Kadiolo and Hérémakono), for cash and often on credit.

He's very much in demand and his customer's orders are constantly increasing, but his own resources are insufficient to meet his clientele's demands. 

In order to correct this problem, he decided more than one year ago to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which he is now seeking his second loan, to be used to buy one ton of scrap metal.

Thanks to this loan, he foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 150'000 (ca US$ 300), to be mainly used to bolster his working capital, help with the family's expenses, and pay the interests of his loan.

loans.use: to buy one ton of scrap metal

loans.name: Davis

texts.es: Davis, de 37 años de edad, es un joven empeñoso y trabajador con muchas ansias de sobresalir y construirse un futuro mejor y mejorar  su calidad de visa y la de los su familia. Es conviviente  con Rospita con quien tiene  un negocio mutuo y es la madre de sus 03 hijos de 5 , 3 y 2 años de edad quienes son su motivación para seguir trabajando. Todos juntos viven cómodamente en su propia casa que compró con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. La actividad que realiza Davos en al de venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para esto abrió una pequeña bodega en su casa, donde acondicionó e implementó todos sus productos necesarios y solicitados por sus clientes a quienes atiende de manera amable y cordial y hasta el momento le ayuda su pareja en la atención al público. Se inició hace 02 años comprando en pequeñas cantidades con su propio capital, y viendo que le daba resultados positivos se decidió continuar, ahora compra en mayor volumen y viendo las necesidades y los requerimientos de sus clientes, así se gana su presencia, logrando que  posteriormente regresen a comprar en su bodega. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional para poder solventar sus gastos, los cuales aumentaron con la llevada de su tercer hijo, busco alternativas de solución encontrando éste negocio que le ha sacado de apuros. Por tanto, tiene planes de comprar un mayor volumen de mercaderías para ver crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo numero 03 con la institución MFP. Está contento de saber que contará con una apoyo financiero para poder avanzar y hacer crecer más su negocio. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir en el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores, de esa manera tener acceso a más créditos en un futuro. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías en mayor volumen y variada para tener un stock disponible  para la venta  y teniendo en cuenta las preferencias de sus clientes. Además buscará precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen para tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Davis, 37 years old, is an earnest young man and a worker with a desire to succeed and create a better future and improve his quality of life and that of his family. He lives with Rospita with whom he has a joint business and who is the mother of their three children aged five, three, and two years old who are his motivation to continue working. They all live comfortably together in their own home that he bought with a lot of effort and work. 

Davis sells basic groceries, and in order to do that he opened a little store in his home where he remodeled and stocked up on all of his necessary products and orders from clients who he serves in a friendly and cordial way. So far his partner helps him serve customers. 

He began two years ago with small amounts of his own money and seeing that it gave him good results he decided to continue. Now he buys in greater volume and seeing the needs and requirements of his customers, he earns their loyalty and they come back to buy things in his store. He believes his business to be very profitable due to the good earnings it provides him. Seeing the need to have an additional income in order to cover expenses which grew with the birth of his third son, he looked for alternative solutions settling on this business which met his needs. 

He has plans to buy a great volume of merchandise in order to grow his business. This will be his third loan with MFP. He is happy to know that he will have the financial backing to advance and further grow his business. He promises to comply with the terms of his agreement as with previous loans, and in that way he will have access to more loans in the future. He says that he feels happy with the communal bank since he knows the members and finds them to be responsible and team-minded people. 

He will invest the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles into the purchase of a great volume and variety of merchandise in order to have available stock for sale and to have what his customers like. Also, he will look for the cheapest prices for his volume purchases to have the best profit margins.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery store products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric to make blouses.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda de 39 años, convive con Edgar, con quien tiene 5 hijos de 9, 8, 5, 4 y 2 años de edad. Esta numerosa pero unida familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Inchatingari, distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo.
Hermelinda es una mujer de negocios. Hace 20 años que empezó a trabajar en el campo. En este largo tiempo adquirió 12 parcelas de terrenos distribuidas en distintas partes de su localidad. En ellas produce cítricos como naranjas y limones; además de café y achiote. Y como sus cultivos se encuentran a distancias considerables de su hogar, ella se levanta de madrugada para llegar a tiempo a sus cultivos
“Al año cosecho 20 sacos de café, cada uno de 60 a 70 kilos”, menciona.
Ella sabe muy bien cómo debe negociar su producción. Por ejemplo cosecha café en los meses de abril, mayo y junio; cosecha achiote en octubre y noviembre; y naranjas en diciembre y noviembre. De esa manera genera ingresos para su familia en casi todo el año. Hermelinda es inteligente, por eso ahora piensa sembrar otra parcela de café, para ello deberá invertir en fertilizantes y plantitas de café.
Su anhelo es ver a sus hijos como personas independientes y desarrolladas, por eso no descansará en sus labores para brindarles lo necesario para conseguir sus metas. Hermelinda estaría accediendo a su crédito número 3 de MFP, gracias a su ayuda, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales, como lo hizo antes. “Los productores Inchatingari” es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente contenta de formar parte de un grupo solidario.
Ella invertirá el dinero en el pago de jornaleros a quienes contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos. Además comprará plantitas de naranjas por 3 soles y 50 céntimos cada una; y algunas plantas de café así iniciará nuevas siembras.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, age 39, lives with Edgar.  They have five children, ages 9, 8, 5, 4, and 2.  This large but united family lives in a house in the native community of Inchatingari in the Perené district, Chanchamayo province.

Hermelinda is a businesswoman.  Twenty years ago she started working in the fields.  During this large amount of time she acquired 12 parcels of land, which are spread out in different parts of her locality.  On those parcels she produces citrus like oranges and lemons.  She also produces coffee and annatto.  As her crops can be found at considerable distances from her home, she gets up early in the morning to get to her crops on time.

“I harvest 20 sacks of coffee a year, and each sack is 60 to 70 kilos,” she says.  She knows very well how she needs to manage her production.  For example, she harvests coffee in April, May, and June.  She harvests annatto in October and November, and she harvests oranges in December and November.  This way she generates income for her family for almost the whole year.

Hermelinda is intelligent.  She is now planning on planting another parcel of coffee.  In order to do so she needs to buy fertilizers and coffee seedlings.  

Her hope is to see her children become independent and mature people.  Therefore, she will not rest from her work in order to give them what they need  to obtain their goals.

This is Hermelinda’s third loan with MFP, thanks to your help.  She pledges to make her monthly payments punctually as she did before.  Los Productores Inchatingari is the name of her communal bank.  She is happy to be part of a supportive group.

She will use the money to pay day workers who she will contract to clear the weeds from her crops.  She will also buy orange seedlings for 3 soles and 50 céntimos and some coffee plants.  This way she will start new crops.

loans.use: to buy coffee and orange plants.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga de 31 años se separó del padre de sus 3 hijos de 15, 12 y 6 años. Ella y sus hijos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Inchatingari, distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo.
Olga es una mujer como pocas.Su fuerza le hizo superar la decepción que significó la separación con su pareja. Ahora ella sola se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos. Ella es agricultora, hace 10 años; actualmente cuenta con 9 lotes de terrenos de cultivos, que su comunidad y sus padres le otorgaron. En ellos siembra café, achiote, y cítricos como naranjas y tanyelos. “cada año cosecho 1500 kilos de achiote, cada kilo lo vendo a 4 soles, si es rentable”, dice.
El trabajo es muy cansado, por eso recibe de su hijo mayor, pero cuando las jornadas son intensas recurre a contratar personal como jornaleros para las cosechas. “En mayo las ventas son buenas, porque el café alcanza el precio más alto”, menciona. 
Olga, a pesar de todo, está contenta con su labor, porque todo lo obtiene es producto de su esfuerzo. Ahora espera producir otra parcela de café, para ello deberá limpiar sus cultivos para plantar nuevos cafetales.
Éste sería su crédito número 3 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el  pago de las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse respaldada con su banco comunal “Productores de Inchatingari”, porque sus compañeros comparten los mismos planes.
Invertirá el dinero de su crédito en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus terrenos de cultivos de la mala yerba y la maleza. Así iniciará otra siembra de café.
texts.en:
Olga, aged 31, is separated from the father of her three children who are aged 15, 12 and 6.  She and her children live in their own home in the native community of Inchatingari, in the district of Perené and province of Chanchamayo.

Olga is a woman like few others.  Her strength allowed her to overcome the deception that led to her separation from her partner.  Today, she takes care of her children on her own.  She has been a farmer for the last ten years; she currently has nine lots of cultivated farmland that her community and parents have provided to her.  On these she grows coffee, achiote (which is used for a spice), and citrus crops such as oranges and tangelos.  "Each year I harvest 1500 kilos of achiote.  I sell each kilo for 4 soles, if it's profitable", she says.

The work is very tiring, which is why she is helped by her older son, but when the days are intense, she turns to hiring people such as day-laborers for the harvests.  "Sales are good in May, because coffee reaches its highest price", she mentions.

In spite of everything, Olga is happy with her work because everything she earns is the result of her efforts.  She is now hoping to to grow another area of coffee, for which she needs to clear the fields so that she can plant new coffee-plants.

This will be her third loan from MFP, and so she agrees to be punctual with her monthly repayments.  She affirms that she feels supported by her communal bank, called "Productores de Inchatingari” ["Producers of Inchatingari"], because her colleagues share the same plans.

She will invest the money from her loan in payment for day-laborers, whom she will hire to clear her fields of brush and weeds.  In this way she will be able to start her additional coffee planting.

loans.use: to hire day-laborers.

Since she joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, Teresia has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy movie tapes and DVDs for resale.

She earns extra income from her rental houses. Since Susan joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has been able save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. Susan has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy washing chemicals for resale.

loans.use: to buy washing chemicals for resale.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is 23 years old. He runs a video show business to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years and employs two people. Since he joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. Gilbert has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a flat screen television to use in his video show business.

loans.use: to buy a flat screen television to use in his video show business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, 40, is married with three children. To earn a living, she runs a retail shop. Ruth has been in this business for six years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a businesswoman who sells second hand clothes to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years and has employed one person. Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand it further in the future. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy second hand sweaters, skirts and blouses to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand sweaters, skirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Saludia

texts.es:
Saludia de 39 años de edad casado con Eulogio de 42 años fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Torrerumi del distrito de Sivia.
Saludia es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica al trabajo en la agricultura, ella cultiva cacao y café en su parcela ubicada en su misma comunidad. Saludia siempre a estado pendiente de sus cultivos juntamente con su querido esposo. Cuenta que el cultivo de café requiere de mano de obra, asi como en la cosecha, pues si es que se pasa la fecha los granos de café empiezan a caerse lo que generaría una perdida económica. Es por ello que ella anticipadamente busca sus personales para de esta manera prevenirse  de cualquier  percance.
Ella esta feliz  y contenta con su trabajo por que le genera un buen ingreso económico en un futuro esta pensando abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa por que se encuentra en un local casi céntrico. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella, una vez más se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Saludia esta feliz con su banco comunal, por que todos  son puntuales y solidarios.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizara el deshierbo de su parcela agrícola, por lo que contratará peones.
texts.en:
Saludia is 39 years old and is married to Eulogio, who is 42.  They have four children and live in their own home in the community of Torrerumi, in the district of Sivia.  

Saludia is a hard-working woman who works in farming.  She grows cacao and coffee on a parcel of land located within her community and she and her dear husband always tend to the crops together.  She says that she needs laborers to cultivate and harvest the coffee.  If the coffee is not harvested in time, the beans begin to fall off and this causes a loss of income.  So, she is looking for workers in advance in order to prevent any setbacks.

She is happy and content with her work because it generates good income. Since her home is almost centrally located, she is thinking about opening a grocery store there in the future.   This is her second loan with MFP and once again, she is committed to making her payments on time.  She is happy with her communal bank because the members are punctual and she shares a feeling of solidarity with them.  With the 2,000 Nuevos Soles, she will hire laborers to weed her farmland.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito de 40 años está casado con Marleni, la madre de sus 7 hijos, pero solo vive con 5 de ellos cuyas edades varían entre los 18 y 4 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Inchatingari, distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo.
Benito  trabaja desde que era un niño. A su corta edad ya trabajaba en los terrenos de cultivos de sus padres, así aprendió sobre la actividad agrícola, con la que actualmente, mantiene  a su familia. Lleva más de 20 años en esta actividad y en todo este tiempo tuvo que afrontar buenas y malas experiencias.
Cuenta con 4 lotes de café en producción y 2 parcelas en las que siembra cítricos, paltas y achiote.
“El año pasado renové (sembrar pequeñas plantas) una chacra de café, por eso me dedico a limpiar y abonar el terreno para que crezcan sano”, afirma.
Cuando el trabajo en las chacras no requiere de más cuidados, se dedica a laborar como jornalero en otras parcelas. Así obtiene otros ingresos para sus gastos diarios.
Toda su producción la comercializa en el mercado de frutas Pichanaki, ahí llegan compradores de varias ciudades, quienes pagan un precio justo por sus cosechas.
Uno de sus propósitos es renovar otros cultivos, puesto que, los cafetales ya están viejos y sus producción de granos está disminuyendo. Éste sería su crédito número 3 que espera obtener de MFP. Por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. EL trabajo en grupo es lo más le gusta, porque puede reírse y conversar con sus compañeros, “Productores Inchatingari”, es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente cómodo de ser parte de él. Destinará el dinero en la compra de semillas de café, bolsas de abono; y en el pago de los jornaleros quienes sembrarán las pequeñas plantas de café.
texts.en:
Benito, 40, is married to Marleni, the mother of his 7 children.  However, he lives with only 5 of them, and they range from 4 to 18 years of age.  This family lives in their own home in the indigenous community of Inchatingari in the district of Perene, in Chanchamayo province.

Benito has worked ever since he was a child.  Even at a young age, he was already working cultivating his parent's land, and this is how he learned to farm.  He now supports his family working as a farmer.  He has been farming for more than 20 years, and over all of this time he has had good times, and has also had to face some bad experiences.

He currently has 4 lots of land in coffee production, and 2 other parcels of land where he is growing citrus fruit, avocados and achiote trees.

He says, "this past year I renewed my coffee farm (put in small plants), and to do this I devoted my time to clearing and fertilizing the land so that they will have healthy growth."

When his fields require no further care, he hires himself out as a farmworker to work on other parcels of land. This way he gets extra income for his daily expenses.

He sells all of his products in the Pichanaki fruit market.  Buyers come to this market from various cities, and they pay a fair price for his harvested products.  

One of his goals is to renew some of his other crops, because some of his coffee fields are old and their production of beans is diminishing.  This loan that he hopes to get will be his 3rd from MFP.  As such, he gives his word that he will be punctual with his payments.  The thing he likes the most is working with his group, because there he can laugh and converse with his fellow group members.  The name of his group is “Productores Inchatingari," and he feels very comfortable being a part of this group.  The money from this loan will be used to purchase coffee seeds, sacks of organic fertilizer, and to pay for workers that he will hire to put in the small coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds, sacks of organic fertilizer, and to hire farmworkers

loans.name: Subhiya

texts.en:
Subhiya is a 48-year-old housewife who has three sons and one daughter.
In the last three years, Subhiya has been running a tailoring business from home and she also sells fabric from time to time. She only has one sewing machine, so Subhiya has applied for a loan to buy another sewing machine and additional sewing thread.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Afat

texts.en:
Afat, 54, is married with four children and has bred cattle and cows for the last 10 years. Afat was a housewife and her husband was unemployed when she decided to purchase her first cow.

Afat usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months and then resells them for a profit in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 320 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) and this business is the only source of income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Afat also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.

She wants to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. She has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase one cattle, one milk cow and fodder.

loans.use: to buy one cattle, one milk cow and fodder.

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en:
Guloglan, 46, is married with three children and has bred calves and cows for the last 20 years. After several attempts to find a job, he gave up and decided to start his business. With the help of his wife, he purchased his first cattle.

Guloglan usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months and then resells them for a profit in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 230 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) and this business is his family's only source of income. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Guloglan also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. His wife helps him to look after their cattle.

Guloglan wants to expand his business and to improve his family's living conditions. He has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase two calves, one milk cow and fodder. This will be his sixth loan from AqroInvest CU and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two calves, one milk cow and fodder.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto de 56 años de edad casado con Martha de 45 años fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Torrerumi del distrito de Sivia. Modesto es un hombre bondadoso con anhelos de lograr sus objetivos como el de lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales. Para ello necesita invertir una buena suma de dinero y el único ingreso con que cuenta Modesto es de la producción que pueda obtener de sus plantaciones de cacao y café, pues para lograr una buena producción él se dedica diariamente a mantener limpia su parcela, realizar el manejo adecuado y su respectiva fertilización del campo agrícola por que con los años que tiene su campo agrícola esta ya empobrecida de nutrientes, es por ello que es inevitable la fertilización. Modesto esta contento por el momento con su producción por que sus productos los vende en un precio razonable que compensa con el trabajo que realiza.
En un futuro desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que modesto se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Modesto esta alegre por que en su banco comunal realizan un trabajo optimo.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles invertirá en el mantenimiento de su parcela de cacao, para ello comprará abono.
texts.en:
Modesto, 56 years old, is married to Martha, who is 45 years old. As the result of this relationship, they have 4 children. They live in their own home in the Torrerumi community in the district of Sivia. Modesto is a kindhearted man with a strong desire to achieve his objectives, such as achieving that his children become professionals. To achieve that goal he needs to invest a good amount of money. The only income he has is the production that he is able to obtain from his plantations of cacao and coffee. To obtain good production, he devotes himself daily to keeping his plot of land clean, doing the required maintenance work on the land, and fertilizing his plot as needed. Due to the age of his field, the soil is now lacking in nutrients. For this reason fertilization is inevitable. Modesto is happy with his production at the moment because he is able to sell his products at a reasonable price that compensates him for all of the work he puts in to his production. 

Some day he would like to open a grocery store.

This is his first loan with Kiva’s partner, MFP, and he commits to making all of his payments on time. Modesto is happy because his communal bank does a top-quality job.  

He will invest the 1,000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles (PEN) in the maintenance of his plot of cacao. To maintain the plot, he will buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, 33, (in the photo) and his wife Sy Nourn, 28, live in a village outside Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have two young children, one son and one daughter.
 
Chantha and his wife are farmers who grow rice on their farmland in the village where they live. In addition, Chantha drives a motor taxi when he is free.

Chantha is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his rice farming.

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en:
Maleyka, 50, is on pension and is married with one son. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods such as office supplies, perfumes and home products. She has 20 years of experience in this field, making her a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The products she sells are very popular. Maleyka is always friendly and polite with her customers, which makes her business successful. Her monthly profit is 250 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). As this is the family's only source of income, Maleyka's husband helps her with the business.

Maleyka would like to expand her business and purchase more merchandise and diversify the range of products she sells. For this purpose she has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. She has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history and this will be her fifth loan.

loans.use: to buy more office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Sety

texts.es:
Sety, de 23 años de edad, es una joven mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante por sus propios méritos, además de ser amable y cordial con las personas. Es conviviente con Eli quien es empleado y padre de su hija Jilary de 2 años de edad por quien se esfuerza en trabajar. Juntos viven en casa de sus padres en compañía de su hermano. La actividad que realiza Sety es la venta de comidas como pollos asados, juanes, estofados y refrescos. Para eso cuenta con una mesa que instala en el frontis de su casa todas la tardes,  donde atiende muy bien a sus clientes que le consumen a diario sus comidas, ganándose sus preferencias. También cuenta con un mototaxi que lo alquila generándoles más ingresos económicos.
Se  inició hace más de 1 año con un préstamo particular y hasta el momento lo viene realizando con el apoyo de su mamá en la atención a los clientes. Considera a su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene sus comidas ya que sus clientes siempre la esperan para consumirle, logrando acabar continuamente lo que prepara para la venta.
Se decidió empezar a trabajar por la llegada de su hija y la necesidad de incrementar los ingresos de su hogar, para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
Por tanto, y viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo con sus negocios, tiene planes de realizar arreglos en su casa y acondicionar una cochera para brindar servicio de guarda de vehículos. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Está contenta y agradecida al saber que continuará contando con una línea de crédito para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de accesorios para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, así como el trámite de sus documentos y con el saldo en ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Sety, 23 years old, is a young woman with a lot of drive to get ahead on her own merits as well as to be friendly and polite to people. She lives with Eli who works and is the father of her daughter Jilary, 2 years old, for whom she motivates herself to work. They live together in her parents’ home along with her brother. 

Sety sells food like roast chicken, Peruvian tamales, stews, and beverages. She has a table that she’s set up in front of her house each afternoon where she gives good service to her customers who eat her food every day, earning their loyalty. She also has a moto-taxi that she rents, generating more income. 

She began more than one year ago with a loan, and so far she’s had her mom’s help in serving customers. She believes her business to be profitable due to the earnings it provides and the demand that she has for her food since her customers always want to eat it, regularly selling out of what she’s made to sell. 

She decided to begin work after the birth of her daughter and due to the need to increase the household income in order to provide a better quality of life. Because of that and seeing the good results that she’s had from her business, she has plans to redo her home and set up a garage in order to provide car storage service. 

This will be her third loan with MFP. She is happy and thankful to know that she will continue to have a line of credit in order to implement her plans. She also likes her communal bank’s work since she considers it to be a united and solid group. She will invest the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles into the purchase of products to maintain her moto-taxi, such as the processing of documents, and with the remainder she will buy ingredients to make her food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food and parts for her moto-taxi.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diyaa

texts.en:
