Zoila invested her previous loan in buying fruit and she didn't experience any problems in making her repayments.  It was very helpful to her as she was able to use the profits she made to improve her family's situation.

Zoila will invest her new loan in buying fruit too.  She will also make some repairs to her premises so that they look better.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because of the camaraderie that exists within the group.  Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy fruit and make some repairs to her premises

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer de 35 años de edad, casado con Edika de 34 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Llochegua. Wilmer desde muy niño tuvo que trabajar duro por ganarse la vida. Él cuando apenas tenía 11 años de edad incursionó en el negocio de venta de golosinas, es así que todas las tardes ofrecía en la calle sus productos. De esta manera logró solventar los gastos del colegio, ya que no contaba con suficiente apoyo de sus padres. Cuando Wilmer cursaba el cuarto año de secundaria, optó por formar su familia y dejar de estudiar, y ahora tiene que preocuparse por mantener a su familia, por lo que trabaja muy duro para juntar un capital. En su tiempo de ahorro logró montar una tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad de tener un ingreso. En un inicio no le era tan rentable pero tiempo después se hizo el mas conocido ya que está creciendo de manera sorprendente. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que Wilmer se compromete en cancelar puntualmente en el pago de sus cuotas. Él esta contento con su banco comunal por que son solidarios. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles invertirá en el incremento de mercadería.
texts.en:
35-year-old Wilmer is married to Edika who is 34.  The couple have three children and live in their own home, in Llochegua district.  Wilmer has had to work hard to earn a living from a very young age.  When he was just 11 years old he started out in business, selling candies.  Every afternoon he sold his products in the street.  In this way, he managed to cover his school expenses as he didn't have enough support from his parents.  When Wilmer was in the fourth year of high school, he chose to form a family and stopped studying.  With a family to support, he had to work very hard to build up some capital.  As he was saving, he managed to set up a grocery store in order to make an income.  At first it wasn't so profitable but, over time, he became more well known and his business is now growing amazingly quickly.

This is Wilmer's second loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time.  He is happy to belong to his community bank because they are all supportive.  He will invest his 2,500 soles in increasing his stock.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his store

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is forty-one years of age, married, and has a fifteen-year-old daughter who stays at home and helps her in doing household tasks. Her husband sells milk and also works in the field where he grows different seasonal crops. In his absence, Nasreen takes care of the milk-selling business. She gives the cattle food and keep their living place clean.

She is also a sewing expert and sews beautiful looking clothes for clients in her neighborhood. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s dairy business. With the loan investment he will buy a dairy cow. This will enable him to get a larger quantity of milk to sell and will increase his profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past many years. Nasreen is confident that his business will be improved further after investing the loan.

Note:"In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Nasreen."

loans.use: To buy a cow for a dairy business.

loans.name: Karen Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Karen es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, reconocida por la belleza de su Centro Histórico, los 4 ríos que la bañan, su gastronomía y la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Karen tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 16, 11 y 4 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios en transporte particular, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros pero independientes.
 
Doña Karen se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, vende ropa americana de todo tipo, también vende zapatos, labora todos los días ya que sus clientes se acercan a su casa a comprar su mercadería.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra reingresando, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y zapatos para crecer en el negocio.

Su meta es tener un restaurante y ejercer su profesión ya que es una profesional en la gastronomía.
texts.en:
Karen is a member of 'Las Flores' community bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which is a World Heritage Site.  Cuenca is well known for the beauty of its historic center, the four rivers that surround it, its cuisine, and the culture and traditions of its villages.

Karen is 33 years old and has three children who are 16, 11 and 4 years old.  Her two eldest daughters are attending high school in the city.  Her husband is a driver and he provides transportation services in his own vehicle.  They do not own their own home.  They live in her in-laws' home but independently.

Karen's business is selling clothing through catalogs.  She sells all kinds of American clothing and also sells shoes.  She works every day because her customers come to her home to buy her merchandise.

Karen is re-joining her community bank.  She will invest her loan in buying clothing and shoes so that she can grow her business.  Her goal is to own a restaurant and to carry out her profession as she is a professional cook.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Ines Elida

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal Las Piedras. Conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Inés, ella tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años de edad, el mayor  estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el campo de la construcción.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles, vende arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carne y otros víveres de primera necesidad, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan cuando pueden, está muy contenta con su negocio ya que aquí se gana algo sin tener que descuidara a sus pequeños, les puede ayudar en sus tareas de la escuela y estar atenta a lo que necesiten, lleva en su negocio tres años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos entre otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 2 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha mejorado su negocio. 

Su sueño es que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of 'Las Piedras' community bank meet in a neighborhood called 'Las Piedras', in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This city is known for its traditional culture, the cheerful nature of its people and its San Pedro and San Pablo celebrations.

Here we meet Inés who is 30 years old, married, and has three children who are 12, 10 and 8.  Her eldest is in high school and her younger two are in elementary school.  Her husband works in the building trade.

Inés has a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, oil, detergents, vegetables, meat and other basic household products.  She works there every day from 6.00am to 8.00pm and sometimes until even later.  Her children and her husband help her when they can.  She is very happy with her business because it allows her to earn something without neglecting her little ones.  She is able to help them with their school work and be alert to their needs.  She has been in her business for three years and it is doing well.

Inés will use her loan to further stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold cuts and other products.  She has been a member of her community bank for more than two years and she likes it because the loans have improved her business.

Inés' dream is for her store to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold cuts and other basic household products

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is thirty-one years old, married, with three children. He does welding to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. He also does farming to earn extra income. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her finish the client orders in a shorter period of time and increase her profits. Her current sewing machine has become old and needs replacement. She is confident that a new sewing machine will help her make more income from her business.

Her husband is also a tailor and an embroidery expert. Rukhsana has given birth to three daughters. Only one of them is able to get an education. Rukhsana wants to send her remaining daughters to school and she is confident that she will be able to do that by improving her business and increasing her income.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Gloria Aida

texts.es:
La Señora. Gloria es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, reconocida por la belleza de su Centro Histórico, por su gastronomía y la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Gloria tiene 26 años, es divorciada pero en su unión conyugal han concebido dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive en es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Gloria se dedica a la fábricación de mesones y pisos de  mármol, este negocio lo tiene hace 5 años y trabaja de lunes a sábados.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana. Su crédito lo va a invertir compra de mármol para su negocio.
 
Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of “The Flowers” cooperative bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a World Heritage Site, known for the beauty of its historic city center, its cuisine, and the culture and traditions of its towns.

Gloria is 26 years old and divorced, however, this marriage yielded two children ages 7 and 5 who attend the little school in the city.  She owns the house they live in.

Gloria dedicates herself to fabricating counters and marble floors.  She has had this business for 5 years, and works Mondays to Saturdays.

This is the first loan she has realized in the cooperative bank, which her sister invited her to join.  She will invest her loan into the purchase of marble for her business.

Her goal is to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase marble.

loans.name: Yolanda Monserrate

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal Las Piedras. Conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo. 

En este lugar vive la señora Yolanda, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad el mismo que este año empieza a estudiar en una escuela local. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella es licenciada en Ciencias De La Educación y trabaja de maestra en una escuela de la ciudad, también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en la escuela y en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda de vestir, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y siempre trata de vender lo que esté de moda, lleva tres años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, trajes de baño, bermudas, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, ropa interior, entre otras prendas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco comunal y le gusta los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener un local donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of 'Las Piedras' community bank meet in a neighborhood called Las Piedras, in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This city is known for its traditional culture, the cheerful nature of its people, and its San Pedro and San Pablo celebrations.

Here we meet Yolanda who is 31 years old, married, and has a 5-year-old son.  This year her son will be attending a local elementary school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Yolanda has a degree in education and she works as a teacher in an elementary school in the city.  She also works in sales.  She sells all kinds of clothes door to door and also sells at school and from her home where her customers come whenever they need any clothes.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and always tries to sell what is in fashion.  She has been in this business for three years and is doing very well.

Yolanda will use this loan to buy pants, swimsuits, Bermuda shorts, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothes, underwear and other garments.  She has been a member of her community bank from the start and she likes the benefits that she receives from the institution.

Yolanda's dream is to have premises where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy pants, swimsuits, Bermuda shorts, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Reina De La Nube (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Reina de la Nube está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que les permiten aportar en la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias, se caracterizan por ser amables y muy gentiles. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad  mas importante del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con mucha variedad en su gastronomía, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mónica, tiene 28 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija está  estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller de tapicería, la casa en la que viven es propia.
 
Doña Mónica al igual que su esposo labora en el taller de tapicería, esta actividad la desempeñan hace 2 años, trabajan de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. 

Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir comprando materiales como telas, cuerinas, pegas, hilos y cierres para el taller y también para la compra de unos lentes para mejorar su visión.

Su meta es crecer en su taller de tapicería.
texts.en:
The Reina de la Nube cooperative bank is comprised of 6 women and 1 man who work in different economic activities on a daily basis.  These endeavors allow them to financially support their households and to get their families ahead.  They are characterized for being very friendly and kind.  They live in the city of Cuenca, the third most important city in the country.  It has been a World Heritage Site since December of 1999, and has a great variety of cuisine; its people maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

One of the members of this group is Mónica.  She is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children ages 6 and 2.  Her first daughter is studying at a little school in the city.  Her husband has an upholstery workshop, and they own the house they live in.

Mónica, like her husband, works in the upholstery workshop.  They have been carrying out this activity for 2 years, working on a set schedule from Mondays to Fridays.

They find themselves taking their third loan with the cooperative bank, and she is going to invest it into buying materials such as fabrics, leathers, glues, threads and fasteners for the workshop, as well as in some eyeglasses to improve her vision.

Her goal is to grow her upholstery workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, leathers, glues, threads, fasteners and eyeglasses.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, de 45 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, es madre de dos hijas a quienes crió y educo sola ya que desde hace muchos años se separó del que fue su conviviente por mucho tiempo. Ella vive en su casa propia y trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas y a su nieto de 3 años a quien cría.
El trabajo de Doris comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a una amiga sale a los caseríos y centros poblados a vender ropa usada y a comprar frutas para surtir su puesto de venta de frutas que tiene en su casa, ahí sus hijas son las que encargan de vender, de esa manera apoyan a su madre. para doris, su trabajo le permite salir a los caseríos ya que ahí encuentra todo tipo de productos, las ganancias que le genera, y al mismo tiempo que se distrae. Lleva ya 12 años en éste negocio y considera que lo mas difícil es tener que salir muy temprano por ser muy peligroso. Recuerda que se inicio con éste negocio debido a los bajos ingresos que había en su hogar y esto ocasionaba que no pudiera brindar una buena educación a sus hijas, pero desde que empezó a trabajar, las cosas mejoraron mucho. Con el tiempo, espera poder empezar a vender ropa nueva que le traerán de la ciudad de Lima. Este será el crédito número siete con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a pagar de manera puntual con sus cuotas y demostrar como en anteriores oportunidades que es una socia muy buena y así retribuir el apoyo que le brindan en su banco comunal en donde todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará más ropa para seguir con su negocio de venta por los caseríos, puesto ya que se acerca la época escolar y ahí crece la demanda de uniformes y zapatos para escolares.
texts.en:
45-year-old Doris is a nice, kind, hard-working woman.  She is the mother of two daughters who she brought up and educated on her own as she separated from her long-term partner many years ago.  Doris lives in her own home and works hard as she would like to provide a better quality of life for her daughters and her 3-year-old grandson who she is raising.

Doris' work starts very early in the morning when she and a friend go out to the villages to sell used clothing and to buy fruit to stock the sales location that she has at home.  Her daughters work there selling her products.  In this way they support their mother.  Doris' work allows her to go out to the villages where she finds all kinds of products.  She makes profits and, at the same time, entertains herself.  She has been in this business for 12 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to go out very early as it is very dangerous.  She recalls that she started out in this business because her household income was low and this meant she was unable to provide her daughters with a good education.  However, since she started working, things improved a lot.  Over time, she hopes to be able to start selling new clothing which she will bring back from the city of Lima.

This will be Doris' seventh loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges, once again, to make her repayments on time and show, once again, that she is a very good member who repays the support she receives from her community bank which is made up of very responsible and supportive people.

Doris will use the 1,500 soles she has requested to buy more clothing so that she can continue in her business selling in the villages.  The start of the school year is approaching and this is a time when the demand for uniforms and school shoes increases.

loans.use: to buy clothing and school uniforms

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 65 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, durante mucho años de su vida vive separada de su esposo con quien tuvo tres hijos, quienes son independientes. Ahora vive en su casa propia a lado de uno de sus hijo y sus dos nietos a quienes cría y por quienes trabaja para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Elizabeth tiene dos trabajos, la primera es el de costurera, se dedica a confeccionar prendas y algunos forros y muebles, además utiliza su tiempo libre para ir a los caseríos y lugares alejados de la ciudad a vender ropa de segunda. Ella tuvo que trabajar desde muy chica ya que la costura lo realiza desde que tenia 14 años y lleva la cuenta de la venta de ropa de segunda desde hace 4 años. Trabaja sola ya que su hijo le ayuda trabajando en su mototaxi recorriendo las calles de la ciudad en busca de pasajeros, por lo que cada tiempo le paga el alquiler, eso le permite otro ingreso adicional a su economía.
Le gusta su trabajo porque dispone de su tiempo y sabe, cuando puede realizar otras actividades y además que genera ganancias ya que tiene clientes que siempre ella visita y le realizan buenas compras. Desea mas adelante tener un taller mas grande en donde pueda contratar más personas y empezar a confeccionar prendas en mayor cantidad. Este será el quinto préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprará materiales y herramientas de costura para continuar con su trabajo, ya que tiene nuevos pedidos y desea cumplir con los mismos.
texts.en:
65-year-old Elizabeth is a nice, kind, hard-working woman who has been separated for a long time from her husband with whom she had three children.  All of her children are now independent.  Elizabeth lives in her own home together with one of her children and her two grandchildren who she is bringing up and for whom she works hard in order to provide them with a better quality of life.

Elizabeth has two jobs.  Her first job is working as a seamstress.  She makes clothing and also some covers and furniture.  She uses her free time to go to the villages and places that are a long way from the city to sell used clothing.  She had to work from a very early age and has been sewing since she was 14.  She has been selling used clothing for four years.  Elizabeth works alone and her son helps her by working in his motorcycle taxi, driving through the city streets in search of passengers.  He pays her rent which makes her an additional income.

Elizabeth enjoys her work because she is in control of her own time and she knows when she is able to carry out other activities.  It also makes her profits because she has customers who she always visits and who make good purchases.  In the future, Elizabeth would like to have a bigger workshop where she can hire more people and start making clothing in larger quantities.  This will be her fifth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges, once again, to make her repayments on time as she has done with her previous loans.  She enjoys belonging to her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Elizabeth will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy materials and tools for her dressmaking business so that she can continue in her work.  She has new orders and would like to fill them.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Calle Cordova (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los 2 socios y las 11 socias del Banco Comunal Calle Córdova. Esta linda ciudad se la conoce por el nombre de la Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace 4 meses atrás y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como, comercio en general, servicios, venta de comida entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Carmen, tiene 56 años y es madre soltera de cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, con ella vive una hija que también es madre soltera.

Doña Carmen para ganarse la vida desde hace varios años puso un restaurante en un mercado de la ciudad, lugar al que asisten muchas personas todos los días, trabaja todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta las 22h00, su hija le ayuda en su negocio, son muchos los clientes que llegan hasta su establecimiento ya que ella cocina muy sabroso y esto le gusta a sus clientes, lleva más de 20 años con su negocio y es con esto que logro sacar adelante a sus hijos cuando aun estaban pequeños y en la actualidad se mantiene con este negocio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar una cocina nueva ya que la que tiene esta dañada y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Es su segundo ciclo en el banco y espera seguir por mucho tiempo.

Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de un socio que por motivos de su trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The 2 male and 11 female members of the Calle Córdova cooperative bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo.  This beautiful city is known as the “City of the Royal Tamarinds”.

This is a group of people who decided to join together 4 months ago to access credit; this has served them well, since the loans have allowed them to improve their small businesses.  They dedicate themselves to a variety of activities including general commerce, services, and food sales, among others.

One of the members of this group is Carmen.  She is 56 years old and the single mother of four children who are now grown.  One daughter, who is also a single mother, still lives with her.

Several years ago, Carmen started a restaurant in the city’s market in order to make a living.  Many people visit her place every day, and she works from 5:00 am until 10:00 pm; her daughter helps with the business.  Her establishment is very busy given that her food is delicious, something that her customers like.  She has been in business for more than 20 years, and it is what allowed her to support her children when they were still young.  Currently, she supports herself with this enterprise.

This loan is for the purchase of a new stove, since the one she has is damaged, and also for supplies to make the food.  This is her second cycle with the bank, and she hopes to continue for a long time.  Her dreams are to have good health and to get ahead.

The small photo that is attached is of a member who, because of work, was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.


La foto pequeña adjunta es de un socio que por motivos de su trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.

loans.use: to buy a stove and supplies.

loans.name: Gino

texts.es: Gino, de 23 años, es un joven amable y emprendedor, está casado y tiene un hijo de un año quien es su inspiración para trabajar día a día. Vive en casa de sus padres a lado de su esposa y sus hermanos. Gino se dedica a la edición de audio y video para conocidos programas de la región, además de alquilar su equipo de sonido y algunos otros equipos para fiestas y eventos sociales de la ciudad. Parte de su trabajo consiste en realizar comerciales, sesiones fotográficas, narrar algunos documentales, etc. Este trabajo lo realiza en la casa de su mamá, ahí le dieron un espacio para que lo convierta en su oficina, él lleva 2 años en éste trabajo, siente que le va bien ya que su clientela ha crecido bastante. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que a parte de trabajar él se divierte haciendo esto ya que es algo que le nació desde muy niño. Durante su tiempo trabajando aprendió muchas cosas y siempre aprende más, a pesar que es nuevo en éste negocio se supo ganar muchos clientes y espera seguir con su etapa se crecimiento. Tiene en mente poder agrandar su negocio comprando parlantes, luces y otros instrumentos más que son necesarios para su trabajo. Este será el tercer préstamo con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará algunos materiales que necesita para seguir implementando su negocio, comprará nuevos parlantes y algunos programas de edición de video.
texts.en:
23-year-old Gino is a kind and entrepreneurial young man.  He is married and has a one-year-old son who is his inspiration to work every day.  Gino lives in his parents' home together with his wife and siblings.  His business is editing audio and video for well-known programs in the region.  He also hires out his sound equipment and other equipment for parties and social events in the city.  Part of his work consists of making commercials, doing photography sessions, narrating documentaries, etc.  He carries out his work from his mom's house where they gave him a space to turn into his office.  He has been in this line of work for two years.  He feels that he is doing well because his customer base has grown quite a lot.  What he enjoys about his work is that he is not only working but enjoying himself at the same time as it is something he has enjoyed doing since he was very young.  He has learned a lot while he has been working and is always learning more.  In spite of the fact that he is new in this business, he has been able to attract a lot of customers and he hopes to continue growing his business.  He plans to expand his business, buying speakers, lights and other equipment that is necessary for his work.

This will be Gino's third loan from MFP.  He is very happy to know that he will have financial support as it will make him feel more secure in making progress in his business.  For his part he pledges, once again, to make his repayments on time as he did with his previous loans.  He enjoys belonging to his community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.  Gino will use the 1,000 soles he has requested to buy some materials that he needs for his business.  He will buy new speakers and some video editing programs.

loans.use: to buy speakers and video editing programs

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 22 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, está casada con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos, ella vive en casa de sus suegros a lado de su esposo y sus hijos, trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Para Jessica el trabajo empieza muy temprano cuando se tiene que levantarse para ir al mercado en busca de los ingredientes necesarios para poder realizar la venta por la noche. Ella vende comida en la vereda de la casa de su suegros, realiza éste trabajo sola y ya va 2 años en éste negocio el cual le está dando buenos ingresos como para poder apoyar en su hogar. Le gusta su trabajo por que tiene tiempo por las tardes para poder estar a lado de sus hijos que aun son muy pequeños y necesitan que su madre esté cerca de ellos. Durante su tiempo trabajando en éste negocio, aprendió a brindarle siempre una sorrisa al cliente y darle una buena atención, pues eso hace que vuelva y no pierda clientela. Espera seguir trabajando así e implementar su negocio con algo más grande. Este será el tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a seguir siendo una socia muy puntual en sus cuotas ya que no desea defraudar a sus compañeras de banco comunal quienes confían mucho en ella y le dieron el respaldo para poder acceder a un crédito. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprar ingredientes, insumos y algunos utensilios para continuar con su trabajo y poder atender a todos sus comensales que día a día aumentan.
texts.en:
22-year-old Jessica is a nice, kind, hard-working woman.  She is married and has two children.  She lives in her in-laws' home together with her husband and children.  She works hard as she would like to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Jessica's work starts very early in the morning when she gets up to go to the market.  Here she seeks out the ingredients she needs to make her evening sales.  Her business is preparing food which she sells on the sidewalk outside her in-laws' house.  She works alone and has been in her business for two years.  It is making her good income with which she is able to support her household.  Jessica enjoys her work as it gives her time free to spend with her children in the afternoons.  Her children are still very young and they need their mother close by.  During the time she has been working in this business, Jessica has learned to always give her customers a smile and good customer service as this makes them come back and, that way, she doesn't lose customers.  She hopes to continue working and to make her business bigger.

This will be Jessica's third loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as this will make her feel more secure in making progress in her business.  For her part she pledges, once again, to make her repayments on time as she doesn't want to let down the members of her community bank who trust her and gave her the support she needed to access a loan.  Jessica will use the 1,500 soles she has requested to buy ingredients, supplies and some utensils she needs to continue in her work and serve all her diners whose number increases every day.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia de 46 años de edad, casado con Obaldo de 44 años, con quien tiene 6 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Llochegua. Teodosia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos desde hace más de 4 años atrás, al ver que ella es conocida por su barrio como vendedora de pollos a precios módicos y el buen trato que brinda al cliente hizo que ella sea la más preferida por los vecinos ante sus competencia. Al sentir  esta confianza ganada de sus vecinos lo motivo a seguir continuando con su negocio ya que hasta el momento todo le va muy bien 
Usualmente trabaja con el apoyo de sus hijos mientras que su esposo se dedica al servicio de transportes.
Teodosia esta contenta con esta labor que realiza por que le genera un buen ingreso económico rentable, mas adelante ella esta pensando incrementar su negocio con la finalidad de satisfacer a tantos clientes insatisfechos que existen. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete  por segunda vez en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles incrementara más pollos para expenderlo.
texts.en:
Teodosia is 46 years old. She is married to 44 year old Obaldo and they have six children. They live in their own house located in the Llochegua district. Teodosia is a very hardworking woman. She has sold chickens for more than four years. She is known in her neighborhood as the chicken seller with reasonable prices. The good treatment she offers to her customers makes her the most preferred among her neighbors compared to her competition. 
Usually she works with the help of her children while her husband works in transportation. 
Teodosia is happy with this work because it generates a good, profitable income. In the future, she is thinking about growing her business in order to satisfy so many unsatisfied customers. This is her second loan with MFP. She promises for a second time to make her payments on time. With the 2,500 nuevos soles, she will buy more chickens in order to sell them.

loans.use: purchase more chickens in order to sell their meat.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza en la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal Las Piedras. Conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo.

En este lugar  vive la señora María, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de 5 años la misma que este año empieza sus estudios escolares. El marido es chofer en una empresa de agua. Ella estudia a distancia en la Universidad de Guayaquil los sabados y domingos.

Doña María tiene un almacén en el que se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatillas  y accesorios de la marca Belesa. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30  hasta las 18h00, tiene su almacén hace dos años pero antes de eso se dedicaba a vender puerta a puerta pero poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta poner su local. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Huaquillas, Guayaquil y Ambato una o dos veces al  mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, ropa interior, zapatillas, entre otras prendas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de dos años  y  le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es aumentar aun más  su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the cooperative bank Las Piedras meet every fifteen days in the sector known as Las Piedras of the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its traditional culture, for the happiness of its people, and its festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo.

In this location lives María, who is 24 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has a 5-year old daughter who will start school this year.  Her husband is a driver for a water company.  She studies long-distance at the University of Guayaquil on Saturdays and Sundays.

María has a store where she dedicates herself to the sale of all types of clothing, shoes, and accessories from the Belesa brand.  She works every day from 8:30 am to 6:00 pm.  She has had her store for two years but, prior to that, she sold door-to-door and slowly saved enough to open her site.  She goes to buy her merchandise in Huaquillas, Guayaquil and Ambato once or twice a month, depending on her needs.

This loan is for the purchase of pants, t-shirts, blouses, children’s clothing, undergarments, and shoes, among other garments.  She has been in the cooperative bank for more than two years, and likes it because of the assistance they provide with the loans.

Her dream is to augment her business more.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing, undergarments, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras. Conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Cruz. Tiene 53 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo seis  hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella, uno está comprometido y vive con su esposa y su hijo pequeño y la menor que está soltera.
 
Ella  realiza el crédito para hijo ya que es él quien se hace cargo de los gastos familiares, su hijo se dedica a la venta de legumbres y mariscos, muy de mañana él se desplaza hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar las legumbres y el pescado para luego recorrer la ciudad en su carro. En las tardes también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo en esto si le ayudan su mamá y la esposa ya que muchos clientes llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus prendas. Lleva siete años dedicado al comercio  y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para que su hijo compre legumbres, mariscos y ropa de todo tipo para sus negocios. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que les brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
The members of the cooperative bank Las Piedras meet every fifteen days in the sector known as Las Piedras of the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its traditional culture, for the happiness of its people, and its festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo.

This is where we get to know Cruz.  She is 53 years old and her husband passed away several years ago, however, she had six children from this relationship who are now grown.  Two of them still live with her; one is married and lives there with his wife and young son, and the youngest, a daughter, is still single. 

She takes this loan for her son, as he is the person in charge of the household’s expenses.  Her son dedicates himself to selling vegetables and seafood.  Very early in the morning, he goes to the wholesale market to buy the vegetables and seafood to later travel the city in his car.  In the afternoons, he also dedicates himself to selling all types of clothing, which his mother and wife help him out with since many customers come to their home to buy clothing.  He dedicated himself to commerce for seven years, and things have gone very well.

This loan is for her son to purchase vegetables, seafood and a variety of clothing for his businesses.  She is a founding member of the cooperative bank, and likes it because of the help and benefits provided by the institution.

Her dream is to have a store in her house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, seafood and clothing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 40 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, es madre de tres hijos a quienes educa y cría con la finalidad de hacerlos personas productivas para la sociedad en el futuro, ella está casada y comparte su casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos.
Para María el negocio de la venta de ropa ha sido una actividad que le ha ayudado a obtener los ingresos necesarios para poder ayudar en la economía de su hogar. Ella lleva ya casi cuatro años con éste negocio que lo realiza entre sus amigos y familiares, al mismo tiempo de su negocio de venta de ropa, también se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos y de cuidado personal. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues puede conversar con sus clientes y considera que lo mas difícil es tener que caminar a la casa de sus clientes para poder ofrecer sus productos, aun así sabe que es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Tiene muchos clientes ya que durante su tiempo trabajando en éste negocio aprendió a ganárselos. Espera con el tiempo tener un puesto de ropa en el mercado mayorista que está en construcción ya que una de sus metas es poder comprar un stand en dicho mercado. Este será el préstamo número 7 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Le gusta mucho ser parte de éste banco comunal ya que todos son buenos socios puntuales y solidarios dentro de su banco.
Con el monto solicitado 600 soles, comprará algunas prendas de vestir para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes y los mantenga siempre a la moda y contentos.
texts.en:
María, 40, is a friendly and hardworking woman. She is mother to three children who she has raised and educated with the hope that in the future they will become productive members of society. She is married and lives with her husband and children in her own home.

Her clothing business has helped María to obtain enough income to contribute to the household expenses. She has been selling clothes among her family and friends for nearly four years. As well as her clothing business, she also sells cosmetics and personal care products. She likes her work very much as she gets to chat with her customers. She thinks that the most difficult part is having to walk from house to house to offer her products to her customers, but she knows that this is an unavoidable part of her job.

She has a large customer base as over time she has learnt how to earn their loyalty. She hopes with time to have a clothes stall in the wholesale market which is currently under construction - this is one of her goals.

This will be María's seventh loan with MFP. She is very pleased to know that she will have financial support, as it means she can feel confident of advancing her business. For her part, she promises to once again keep up with her repayments, as she has in the past with previous loans. She very much enjoys being part of this communal bank, as all the members are punctual and supportive to each other.

With the loan of 600 soles María has requested, she will buy items of clothing to offer to her customers, so she can keep them up-to-date with fashion and happy.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana Isabel de 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en la Colonia Flor del Valle, San Pedro Sula, junto a su hija de 20 años.
Doña Ana tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de tortillas de maíz, hace tortillas normales y tortillas para hacer tacos. Este negocio lo inicio con sus propios esfuerzos, el que fue heredado por su madre y lo ha podido mantener desde entonces. Trabaja todo el día, todos los días de la semana.
Solicita este préstamo de 15,000.00 Lempiras a ODEF para invertirlo en los insumos necesarios como harina de maíz y leña para elaborar las tortillas.
Su meta es ampliar el negocio, mejorar su casa y comprar más bienes necesarios para el hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel, age 45, is a single mother.  She lives with her 20 year old daughter in the Flor del Valle neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

For over 20 years Ana has been making corn tortillas, regular tortillas, and tortillas for making tacos.  She started this business through her own efforts.  She inherited the business from her mother, and she has been able to maintain it from then on.  She works all day every day of the week.

She is requesting this loan from ODEF for 15,000 lempiras.  She will use it to buy the ingredients she needs like corn flour and firewood for making the tortillas.  Her goal is to expand her business, improver her house, and to buy more of the needed household goods.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like corn flour and firewood for making the tortillas.

location.town: Col. Flor del Valle, San Pedro Sula

loans.name: Jiovanni

texts.es:
Jiovanni, es una mujer de 37 años pujante y trabajadora vive en casa de su madre junto a su esposo y 10 personas mas, entre ellos hermanos y sobrinos, trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida su familia. Jiovanni tiene como trabajo el de la compra y venta de madera, en el proceso ellos realizan el aserrío y empaquetado para poder enviarlos a la ciudad de Lima a un comprador que tienen como cliente. Ésta actividad la realiza en los diferentes aserraderos de la ciudad junto a su esposo quien es mas conocido en el negocio ya que trabaja en un aserradero, recuerda que cuando empezó no sabia nada del negocio y tuvo que sufrir mucho para poder consolidarse y empezar a ver mas ganancia en su inversión.
Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es poder invertir y recuperar rápido su dinero, lleva ya 2 años en éste negocio y lo que no le agrada es que tiene que quemarse la piel por el sol, pero vale la pena por que al final se ve los resultados en las ganancias. Este será el crédito número 6 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, además se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además le agrada pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 soles, comprará madera y materiales para continuar con su envío ya que le han solicitado mayor cantidad y quiere cumplir con éste pedido.
texts.en:
Jiovanni is a thriving and hard-working 37 year old woman. She lives in her mother’s house with her husband and 10 more people including siblings, nieces and nephews. She works a lot to give her family a better quality of life. Jiovanni buys and sells wood. She does the milling and packing in order to send it to the city of Lima to a buyer who she has as a customer. She does this work in different sawmills in the city with his husband who is more well known in the business because he already works at a mill.  She remembers when she started this work she didn’t know anything about the business. She had to suffer a lot in order to consolidate and to start to see more profits in her investment.
What she likes most about her work is that she can invest and recoup her money quickly. She has worked in this business for two years. She doesn’t like that she gets sun burns but it is worth it in the end because of the results in the profits. This will be her sixth loan with MFP. She very happy to know she will have financial help. She will feel more secure in advancing with her work. In addition, she promises once again to make her payments on time like she has done with the previous loans. Also, she likes belonging to her communal bank because everyone is very responsible and unified. With the loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase wood and materials in order to continue with her delivery since a large quantity has been requested and she wants to fulfill this order.

loans.use: purchase more wood.

loans.name: Radiya

texts.en:
Radiya is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take the photo instead.

Radiya is a 38-year-old housewife. Her husband, Atiya, works for the government. They have no children.

Radiya started a small retail business three years ago to fill her free time and to improve their living conditions. Her business is basically selling blankets and bed covers, but now she wants to add clothes to the goods she sells, so she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add clothes to the goods she sells.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa, a 26-year-old single lady, is living with her parents and six siblings.

A year ago, Sharifa started a small retail business to help the family improve their living conditions, Sharifa sells blankets and bed covers, and she wants to add home products to her business. 

She has applied for a loan to buy a collection of home products to sell.

loans.use: to buy a collection of home products to sell.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 44-year-old housewife with four sons, the oldest of whom is 22 years old.

Iman has been raising and selling birds for the last six years. At first, it was as a way for her boys to start doing a trading business, but now that her sons have grown up, she decided to continue doing the same business since she finds joy in buying and selling different type of birds.

Now Iman has applied for a loan to buy new types of birds to sell.

loans.use: to buy new types of birds to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Janneth

texts.es:
Sandra Janeth tiene 39 años de edad, es divorciada, tiene dos hijos de 17 y 7 años de edad, los dos están estudiando, y  vive con ellos en el Barrio Pueblo Nuevo de Choloma, Cortes.

Sandra tiene un negocio de barbería en la cual ofrece los servicios de corte de cabello de adultos, niños, corté de barba y de cejas. Inicio este negocio hace 2 años teniendo la habilidad para ejercerlo lo estableció con capital propio. En el cual le ha ido bien obteniendo buenos  ganancias de las cuales ha seguido trabajando en la inversión del mismo. Es una mujer trabajadora  que ha podido sola mantener a sus hijos. Además de atender la barbería, ofrece a sus clientes venta de productos de herbalife y ahora le va mucho mejor. Empezando su labor desde las 2.00pm hasta la 8.00pm.

Doña Sandra quiere un préstamo de 2,500  lempiras para comprar  productos de belleza, gelatina para el cabello, polvos, maquina de afeitar, toallas, peines. Esta inversión le ayudara a mantener estable el negocio para obtener mejores ganancias.

Su meta es seguir trabajando y darle la educación que sus hijos necesiten.
texts.en:
Sandra Janeth, age 30, is divorced and has two children, ages 17 and 7.  Both of them go to school.  She lives with them in the Pueblo Nuevo neighborhood of Choloma, Cortes.

Sandra has a barber business.  She offers her services for cutting adult’s and children’s hair and trimming beards and eyebrows.  She started this business two years ago as she has the ability to practice this profession.  She started with her own capital.  It has been going well for her, and she is getting good income, which she continues to invest in her business.

She is a hard-working woman who has been able to support her children alone.  In addition to seeing to the barber shop, she sells Herbalife products to her customers.  She works from 2:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m.

Sandra wants a loan for 2,500 lempiras to buy beauty products like hair gel, powders, an electric razor, towels, and combs.  This purchase will help her to keep her business stable in order to get better earnings.  Her goal is to continue working and to give her children the education that they need.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like hair gel, powders, an electric razor, towels, and combs.

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en:
Etaf is a 49-year-old married woman.

She has been seven years doing her retail business at home, selling home products and clothes. 

She has applied for a loan now to increase the inventory she has of household products and to try to open a special store for her business.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of household products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old. She does poultry farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. 

She has applied for 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy chicks and feed.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Roger Yovani

texts.es:
Roger Yovani tiene 34 años, es casado y su esposa trabaja en una empresa privada, tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad los dos estudian, vive con su familia en la Colonia Mario Quintanilla de Choloma, Cortes.

Roger trabajaba como operario en una maquila. Pero hace 7 meses tiene su propio negocio de venta de mercadería en general. Este negocio lo inicio con capital propio y lo estableció en su casa de habitación, en donde acondiciono un lugar para poder vender su mercadería. El  manifiesta que en la zona de referencia donde vive hay mucho tráfico de personas y por lo tanto sus ventas han crecido favorablemente, ofreciendo a sus clientes variedad en sandalias, ropa de segunda mano, ropa interior, achinería (juguetes, perfumes, vinchas, etc.). El atiende su negocio todo el día. 
Actualmente el esta solicitando un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para surtir mas su negocio en sandalias  y Ropa de segunda mano. Logrando aumentar su inventario y tener más ingresos.
Su meta es crecer aun más su negocio y así ofrecer mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roger Yovani is 34 years old and married.  His wife works for a private company.  He has two children, ages eight and five, and they go to school.  He lives with his family in the Mario Quintanilla neighborhood in Choloma, Cortes.  

Roger used to work as an operator in a factory.  However, he has had his own business of selling general merchandise for seven months.  He started this business with his own capital.  He set it up in his house in a place that he arranged in order to be able to sell his merchandise. 

He says that there is a lot of pedestrian traffic in the area where he lives.  Therefore, his sales have grown.  He offers his customers a variety of sandals, second-hand clothes, underwear, and nick-knacks (toys, perfumes, and hair bands, etc.).  He sees to his business all day.

He is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to better stock his business with sandals and second-hand clothes.  This way he will manage to increase his inventory and have better income.  His goal is to grow even more in his business.  This way he will offer his children a better quality of life and education.

loans.use: to buy sandals and second-hand clothes to stock his business.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 62 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, vive en casa propia junto a su último hijo quien ya es mayor. Está casada y vive a lado de su esposo. Trabaja duro por que desea tener una mejor calidad de vida. Mercedes es dueña de una bodega que está ubicado en su casa, en donde también vende bebidas heladas. Tiene muchos clientes ya que en la cuadra en donde vive no hay mas bodegas además que el trato que brinda a los clientes hacen que se vayan contentos después de hacer sus compras y vuelvan muy a menudo. Lleva ya en éste negocio 24 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo quienes generan ingresos adicionales con los diferentes trabajos que realizan. Recuerda que cuando empezó con éste negocio, no tenía muchos conocimientos de cómo llevar a cabo éste trabajo, pero con el tiempo aprendió y ahora es una gran experta vendedora y muy querida entre sus clientes. Le agrada su trabajo por que está en contacto con la gente y así no está sola cuando su esposo e hijo salen a trabajar, además le genera buenos ingresos debido a las buenas ventas que tiene a diario.  Este será el octavo préstamo que le otorgará MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará bebidas para aumentar su variedad y calidad que ofrece, además algunos abarrotes y demás artículos que le hacen falta implementar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 62, is a hardworking and innovative woman. She lives in her own house with her husband and her youngest child, a grown-up son. She works very hard because she wants to have a better quality of life. Mercedes runs a convenience store from her house, where she also sells cold drinks. She gets a lot of business as there are no other grocery stores on her block, and also because the good service she provides means that her customers leave happy after doing their shopping, and come back often.

Mercedes has been running her business for 24 years and has the support of her husband and son, who generate additional income with their respective jobs. She remembers how, when she started, she didn't have any knowledge of how to do this kind of work, but with time she learnt and now she is an expert salesperson and very cherished among her customers. She enjoys her job because she gets to be around people so she isn't alone when her husband and son go out to work, and also because it generates a good income thanks to her good levels of daily sales.

This will be Mercedes' eighth loan from MFP, which she hopes to use to carry out her plans. For her part, she promises once again to keep up with her repayments, as she has with previous loans. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, as all its members are responsible and supportive people. With the loan of 3,000 soles, she will buy drinks to increase the variety and quality she offers in her shop, as well as some groceries and other items she needs for her business.

loans.use: To buy essential items and various soft drinks.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 49-year-old married man from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a father of three children.

Omar has toy store. He started with only one store and with his hard work he is now a proud owner of two toy stores. Now, Omar is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase more merchandise to enlarge his business and increase his income.

Omar is looking to purchase more kinds of toys and gifts so that he can be the number one retailer in the industry.

loans.use: to purchase toys for business purposes

loans.name: Sobeida

texts.es:
Sobeida, de 43 años, es una mujer amable, buena y emprendedora, está casada y vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo y sus dos hijos quienes son mayores y tienen familia. Ella trabaja mucho pues desea tener una mejor calidad de vida y una vejez tranquila. El trabajo de Sobeida consiste en la costura, asimismo vende salchipapas, éstos han actividades que la han ayudado para poder obtener los ingresos necesarios y así aportar en la economía del hogar. En la costura se dedica a hacer sabanas y cubre camas y por las noches vende salchipapas en la vereda de su casa. Lleva ya casi 15 años en ésta actividad y le va bien ya que le genera buenas ganancias.
Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es poder conversar con sus clientes y considera que lo más difícil es tener que salir muy temprano a realizar las compras para su venta de las noches. Durante su tiempo de trabajo aprendió a siempre sonrreir a sus clientes ya que así puede mantenerlos y seguir generando mas ventas y aumentar su ganancia. Espera con el tiempo poder remodelar su casa y poder poner ahí un taller más grande y un restaurante de venta de pollo broaster. Este será el quinto préstamo con MFP, le está yendo muy bien con su grupo y está contenta de saber que ahora cuenta con un respaldo económico con el cual podrá seguir realizando su trabajo, además se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual y muy responsable como lo fue hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para continuar con su trabajo, además de algunos materiales y herramientas para continuar con su costura de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Sobeida, 43, is a friendly and hardworking woman. She is married and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children, who are both grown up and have their own families. She works very hard as she hopes to enjoy a better quality of life and a peaceful old age.

Sobeida's work consists of sewing and selling salchipapas (a Peruvian snack of hot dogs and fries), activities which have helped her to obtain a vital income and contribute to the running of the house. In terms of sewing, Sobeida makes sheets and bed linen, and at night she sells salchipapas from the sidewalk outside her house. She has done this job for 15 years and it suits her well as she is able to generate decent earnings.

Sobeida says that what she most enjoys about her job is chatting with her customers, and what she finds most difficult is having to leave home very early to buy what she needs to sell in the evening. During her time in this job, she has learnt the importance of smiling all her customers, as this keeps them coming back and she is able to generate more sales and increase her income. She hopes with time to be able to remodel her home and put in a larger workshop and a Broaster fried chicken restaurant.

This will be Sobeida's fifth loan with MFP. Things are going very well with her group and she is happy to know that she has the financial support she needs to keep doing her work. She promises to carry on being a punctual and responsible member of the bank, as she has been up to now. With the loan of 1,000 soles she has requested, she will buy ingredients and products for her job, as well as some other materials and tools she needs to continue her work making items of clothing.

loans.use: To buy materials and sewing tools, as well as ingredients for making salchipapas (a Peruvian snack of hot dogs and fries).

loans.name: Jose Encarnacion

texts.es:
El señor Jose Encarnacion es soltero, tiene 20 años de edad,estudia en la universidad para prepararse mejor, se dedica al momento a la artesanía al tejido de cortes picos, inició como operario con sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferente clases y colores. ya que quiere mejora y tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Jose Encarnacion is single, 20 years old, and studies at the university to prepare himself better.  He currently works at the craft of knitting with short cuts.  He started as a worker with his parents and has 20 years of experience.

He is asking for a loan to purchase different types and colors of thread since he wants to improve and have a large business.

loans.use: to purchase thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase thread and a loom.

loans.name: Ok

texts.en:
Ok is a 44-year-old married woman who resides in Pouk district of Siem Reap province. She has been blessed with ten children. This is quite a big family and has had the effect of leading her family into poverty even though Ok and her husband have tried hard to fight against it.

Ok is in the business of growing and selling vegetables to generate income. In parallel, her husband manages all rice farming processes both in the rainy season and the dry season to share responsibility for the family.

At present, Ok would like to acquire some funds from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase a plot of farmland for developing her business and to buy rice seeds for growing this season. Ok is very appreciative of the constant support from our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland for developing her business and to buy rice seeds for growing this season.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 32-year-old man; he is married with no children yet. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a low salary, but not enough to cover life's needs and costs.

Eyad is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new washing machine and a refrigerator for his home use. This will improve the family's home living conditions.

Eyad is photographed in the picture.


About this loan product:

FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine and a refrigerator

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is 37 years old, married with one child. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. She does farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business further in the future. She has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sodas, cooking oil and loaves of bread to sell.

loans.use: To buy sodas, cooking oil and loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 30 years old, married with two children. He does carpentry to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy timber to sell.

loans.use: To buy timber for building to sell

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 49 years old and a good mother of five children, four of whom have independent lives. She presently lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom province where she is a local cultivator. Her main crop is rice, from which she is able to generate an income of 10.00 USD per day. 

Hang  is now seeking her first loan from HKL to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to start growing rice this season. In the future, Hang plans to expand her land and increase her output.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to start growing rice this season.

loans.name: Fanik's Group

texts.en:
Fanik is 22 years old, a young Iraqi wife and mother of one child. Like many woman in her city, she is working from her home, using her sewing skills to help support her family.

She has  been using an old sewing machine for the past three years to make dresses for her woman customers and create other small household items based on special orders.

Fanik took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to be able to buy a new sewing machine, fabric, and other raw materials. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, fabric, and other raw materials.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela, de 53 años de edad, es una mujer que le gusta el trabajo, además es alegre y sociable. Es separada del padre de sus hijos, tuvo 7 hijos los cuales ya son mayores e independientes pero comparte su negocio con algunos de ellos.  Vive en su propia casa en compañía de sus 3 nietos de 16, 10 y 6 años de edad, a quienes quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Adela es la venta de comida como almuerzos. La preparación la realiza en su casa y la venta de forma ambulante. Pero ahora se está dedicando más a la entrega de pensión brindando almuerzos a los trabajadores de una obra de construcción civil, teniendo que realizar la entrega de 50 almuerzo diarios a sus pensionados. 
Se inició hace más de 15 años con un préstamo particular, al comienzo lo realizaba sola, pero ahora cuenta con el apoyo de sus 3 hijas en la preparación y entrega de los menús.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por los ingresos fijos y constantes de la pensión que entrega.
Por otro lado comenta que se inició debido a la separación con el padre de sus hijos y la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para mantenerse a sus hijos.
Ahora viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, desea hacer arreglos en su casa para hacer un local de recepciones y alquilarlo, así aumentara sus ingresos y cambiar de negocio a uno más descansado por su edad.
Este será el préstamo número 1 con la institución MFP. Está contenta al saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para concretar sus pales. Por otro lado, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera ser personas amables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, azúcar y otros, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Adela is 53 years old and a woman who likes to work and is happy and sociable.  She is separated from the father of her children.  She has seven children who are adults and independent, but she shares her business with some of them.  She lives in her own house with three of her grandchildren who are 6, 10, and 16 years old, and whom she loves very much.

Adela works selling food, such as lunch.  She prepares it at her house and sells it as a street vendor.  Currently she is providing lunches to workers at a construction site and she has to make 50 lunches every day for them.  She started her business more than 15 years ago with a loan and at the beginning she worked alone.  Now three of her daughters help prepare and deliver the meals.  

She considers her business to be profitable because she has fixed and constant income.  On the other hand, she said that she started the business after her separation from the father of her children, when she needed an income to support her children.  

Now, seeing the good results she is having, she wants to make repairs to her home to make a space for receptions and rent it out so that she can increase her income and change her business to a more restful one at her age.  

This will be her first loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she can count on financial support to realize her plans.  She said that she likes her community bank because she knows the majority of the members and considers them to be kind and supportive people.  With the loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she will purchase ingredients to prepare her food, such as rice, sugar, and other items.  She will be able to look for better prices by buying in volume.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, pasta, and canned goods.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus 2 hermanos Keyla y Vivi de 18 y 17 años de edad respectivamente, además de su mamá y  su papá. La a actividad que realiza Cynthia es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para eso cuenta con una bodega que instaló en la casa de sus padres, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son su vecinos y ha sabido ganarse sus preferencias por el buen trato que les brinda. Se inició hace más de 1 año con un préstamo de MFP y hasta el momento lo realiza sola, pero en ocasiones le ayudan sus hermanas en la atención  a los clientes.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable pues sus productos son de primera necesidad y que tiene salida a diario, dando una rotación constante a su capital. Antes de empezar con su actividad, no tenía problemas, pero si los deseos de generase sus propios ingresos y apoyara a su padres con los gastos del hogar. 
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene deseos de continuar con su negocio e incursionar en otro negocio de venta de ropa, pues ha visto que es bastante rentable. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con su banco comunal por el apoyo y la solidaridad que siente en sus integrantes. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general para surtir su negocio y así tener un stock variado disponible para la venta, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
24-year-old Cynthia is a hard-working and determined woman who is also kind and friendly.  She has a great desire to do well in life.  Cynthia is single and lives in her parents' home together with her two siblings Keyla and Vivi, who are 18 and 17 years old, as well as her mom and dad.  

Cynthia's business is selling groceries and she has a store in her parents' home where she serves her customers in a kind manner.  Her customers are mainly her neighbors and she has known how to gain their loyalty through the good service she provides.  Cynthia started her business one year ago with a loan from MFP and, up to now, she has worked alone though her sisters sometimes help her to serve her customers.  She considers her business to be fairly profitable as she sells basic household products which always sell well.  This gives her constant capital turnover.  She did not have any problems before starting out in her business but she wanted to make her own income and support her parents with their household expenses.  Given the good results that she has experienced, she would like to continue working in her business and also start a new business selling clothing as she has seen that this is pretty profitable too.

This will be Cynthia's fourth loan from MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have the support she needs to make progress in her business.  She feels comfortable with her community bank because of the support and solidarity that exists between its members.  Cynthia will invest the 1,000 soles she has requested in buying groceries to stock her business so that she has a wide range of goods available for sale.  She will buy her products at low prices because she will be buying in bulk.  This will make her more profits.

loans.use: to buy basic household products

loans.name: Juan Jovany

texts.es:
Juan es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, sus ganas de trabajar le han permitido superar las dificultades y salir adelante junto con su familia. Juan es casado y es padre de 2 hijos de 5 años y otro de 9 meses de nacido. Juan anteriormente trabajaba como artesano, actividad a la cual siempre le ha sacado gusto y con la que durante un tiempo podía generar los ingresos para su hogar. Debido a dificultades que se le presentaron, ajenas a su voluntad, Juan se vio en la obligación de cerrar su taller de artesanías y conseguir un empleo. Durante mucho tiempo se ha venido desempeñando como operario en una empresa de su municipio y gracias a esto ha podido sacar adelante su familia. Sin embargo, ahora quiere retomar la actividad de las artesanías, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina caladora y materias primas para la elaboración de sus artesanías.

Juan espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues esta actividad es mejor remunerada que su empleo como operario. Además, espera que su negocio lo pueda reiniciar y sacar adelante y pueda seguir superando las dificultades que le ha presentado la vida. Juan también sueña con ver a sus hijos grandes, con muy buen estudio y con una mejor calidad de vida que la actual.
texts.en:
Juan is a person who has had to go through a lot of adversity in his life. However, his desire to work has allowed him to overcome the difficulties and to get ahead together with his family. Juan is married and the father of two children, one who is 5 years old and another who was born 9 months ago.
